Posts.Content: GG31 wrote: hello, After 1 year of monitoring the once thought of as 3 separate fibroadenomas with one larger dominant one turns out to be one large one measuring almost 3.8 cm. I am 47 and given the rate of growth am concerned that it is actually a phyllodes tumor which the surgeon will not comment on. Surgery date is booked. Anyone have a similar experience? Thank you! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: growing fibroadenoma having surgery GG31 GG31

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2017 02:26PM GG31 wrote: Hi there, In 2015, I had a lumpectomy for a large fibroadenoma, this left 2 or what they refer to as "bi-lobed" FA remaining. I went every 6 months for an US to monitor them. Following the Jan. 6, 2017 US, the report came back as Bi-RAD 4a as the one lump had some atypical features and shadowing. I just went for my biopsy on Monday this week, the radiologist who performed the biopsy said he was "mildly concerned" so I am quite certain it is just another FA and I will have to continue to monitor it. I find out my results next Thursday so will let you know. It is very hard to not to worry and let your mind wander around. Hopefully it is just a pesky FA for you as well.
Posts.Title: Bi Rad 4 and freaking out Lisbonlix1977 GG31

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2017 05:37PM GG31 wrote: You are absolutley right at wanting life to pause until you have definite answers. Waiting is so hard. I will definitely let you know following my appt on Thursday. I truly hope you receive positive news as well and then we can press 'resume' on our life button!
Posts.Title: Bi Rad 4 and freaking out Lisbonlix1977 GG31

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2015 02:54PM GG31 wrote: Hi there, I was diagnosed in May of 2014 with a fibroadenoma at 46. We did the every 6 month monitoring by ultrasound. At my recent US following in July of this year, the lump had grown considerably and is now just over 3 cm in size. (which I suspected on my own). I have surgery booked for September 8th. The rate in which it has grown makes me nervous about it being a phyllodes tumor. Given my age and the growth rate I believe it is best to have it removed. If it is bothersome, I recommend talking to your doctor or surgeon about having it removed.
Posts.Title: 45 with fibroadenoma ultimatejrfan88 ultimatejrfan88

Posts.Content: GG31 wrote: Hi there, I have a lump (approx. 1.3 cm) that is being biopsied on Monday. I am experiencing pain in the area of the lump, just wondering if anyone else experienced any pain. As an FYI: an excerpt from the US report reads "This lesion has a bllobed appearance with the.larger of the components measuring 6x 6 mm In size and the smaller adjacent component measuring 7 X 5X 5 mm. The overall long and short dimensions of this bilobed lesion are approximately 13 x 7.5 mm . The larger of the components of the bllobed lesion demonstrates a dimension is somewhat taller than it Is wide. There Is some shadowing behind this component and demonstrates some atypical features". BiRADS = 4a Thank you Log in to post a reply
